thread.title: 2nd man charged in slaying of ex-NY pro hockey player's wife
thread.title_full: 2nd man charged in slaying of ex-NY pro hockey player's wife

title: 2nd man charged in slaying of ex-NY pro hockey player's wife
text:
2nd man charged in slaying of ex-NY pro hockey player’s wife By -   
CATON, N.Y. (AP) - A second man has been charged with murder in the slaying of the wife of a former professional hockey player from upstate New York. 
The Steuben (stoo-BEHN’) County Sheriff’s Office announced over the weekend that 44-year-old Michael Beard of Elmira had been arraigned on second-degree murder charges in the death of 35-year-old Kelley Clayton. 
Authorities say she was killed last Tuesday inside her home in the town of Caton, on the Pennsylvania border just west of Elmira. Her husband, 37-year-old Thomas Clayton, was also charged with murder. 
Officials say Beard is an acquaintance of Thomas Clayton. 
Police haven’t said how Kelley Clayton was killed or discussed a motive. 
Thomas Clayton played for Elmira’s minor league hockey team. 
He and Beard are being held in the county jail without bail. It couldn’t be determined if they have lawyers.
